messages.message: I am on a mission to save us all time. Knowledge-seeking activities spend too much of our most precious resource: time. To help save time, let's invest a few minutes now to update this list of technical owners (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zim7M_V_KlWRkOhRsjCdqR16EXxlFyxfq53k6ykUwnk/edit) for our apps and APIs. Please and thank you. Our PMs probably know most of the technical owners @John Hung @Justin @mimi

this is awesome -- but rather than a floating google doc, is there a place where we are tracking these on eng ownership side already (cc @Kerry or whichever EM might know), and if not, is there a place where this should live that is more permanent?

we have this in confluence https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/APPS/overview and if you click into each app there might be frontend contact / backend contact / product contact that represent the engineering and product owner. but that page, as you can see, is pretty out of date. i actually like @Barrie’s google doc better as it has a more up to date list of apps, all the apis, and just focuses on owners. i’m fine with google doc and if we want we can move this to confluence.

I can help fill out people on the list later today or tomorrow. @mimi maybe we can do it in our chat later
Thanks @Barrie @Kerry @mimi - I'd propose that after the GDoc get up-to-date, we put the result in Confluence and commit to an owner reviewing it say quarterly
yes, I like that idea, too @Ryan Baumann and that's where this journey is headed.

@Kerry TIL about this wiki page https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/APPS/overview
we'll want to delete the deprecated apps that are being removed in the October release.

Kerry and I chatted about this. @Barrie if you want to basically take your google doc format and put it in confluence, and add not just technical owner but also columns for product and design, owners from EPD will own keeping the respective cols up to date. And pms can own keeping list of apps up-to-date, and eng can own keeping list of APIs up-to-date (till it doesn't make sense cuz we have too many or we find ways to track it better in github etc)
